entry.title: The Children and Families Act 2014 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Children and Families Act 2014 (c.6) (“the 2014 Act”) on 1st October 2014. Certain provisions came into force on the passing of the 2014 Act. Provisions commenced by previous Commencement Orders are noted below.

entry.title: The Taxi Drivers’ Licences Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the licensing of taxi drivers under the Taxi Act (Northern Ireland) 2008.

entry.title: The Burbo Bank Extension Offshore Wind Farm Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order grants development consent for, and authorises DONG Energy Burbo Extension (UK) Limited to construct, operate and maintain a generating station in the sea approximately 7 kilometres off the north Wirral coast, 8.5 kilometres from Crosby beach and 12.2 kilometres off the coast of Point of Ayr, Wales, being an extension to the existing Burbo Bank offshore wind farm located on the bed of Liverpool Bay, together with all necessary and associated development. The Order imposes requirements in connection with the development for which it grants development consent.

entry.title: The Sulphur Content of Liquid Fuels (Scotland) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations extend to Scotland only. They implement in relation to Scotland those matters concerning heavy fuel oil and gas oil (except marine fuels) contained in Council Directive 1999/32/EC relating to a reduction in the sulphur content of certain liquid fuels and amending Directive 93/12/EEC (OJ L 121, 11.5.1999, p.13) “Directive 1999/32/EC”.

title.div: The Active Travel (Wales) Act 2013 (Commencement) Order 2014 / Gorchymyn Deddf Teithio Llesol (Cymru) 2013 (Cychwyn) 2014

div.p: This Order brings into force all the provisions of the Active Travel (Wales) Act 2013, save for those that commenced on Royal Assent.
Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym holl ddarpariaethau Deddf Teithio Llesol (Cymru) 2013, ac eithrio’r rheini a gychwynnwyd pan gafodd y Ddeddf y Cydsyniad Brenhinol.

entry.title: The Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014 (Publication of Public Spaces Protection Orders) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the manner in which a public spaces protection order made under section 59 of the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014, or extended, varied or discharged under that Act, is to be published.

entry.title: The Legal Aid and Assistance By Way of Representation (Fees for Time at Court and Travelling) (Scotland) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Advice and Assistance (Scotland) Regulations 1996, the Civil Legal Aid (Scotland) (Fees) Regulations 1989, the Criminal Legal Aid (Scotland) (Fees) Regulations 1989 and the Legal Aid in Contempt of Court Proceedings (Scotland) (Fees) Regulations 1992.

title.div: The Council Tax (Chargeable Dwellings) (Amendment) (Wales) Order 2014 / (Anheddau Trethadwy) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2014

div.p: This Order is made under sections 3(5)(b) and 113(1) of the Local Government Finance Act 1992 (“the 1992 Act”) and amends the Council Tax (Chargeable Dwellings) Order 1992 (“the 1992 Order”).

Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn cael ei wneud o dan adrannau 3(5)(b) a 113(1) o Ddeddf Cyllid Llywodraeth Leol 1992 (“Deddf 1992”) ac mae’n diwygio Gorchymyn y Dreth Gyngor (Anheddau Trethadwy) 1992 (“Gorchymyn 1992”).

entry.title: The Tribunal Procedure (First-tier Tribunal) (Immigration and Asylum Chamber) Rules 2014
entry.summary: These Rules replace the Asylum and Immigration Tribunal (Procedure) Rules 2005 (S.I. 2005/230) as amended and the Asylum and Immigration Tribunal (Fast Track Procedure) Rules 2005 (S.I. 2005/560) as amended.

title.div: The Allocation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) (Wales) Regulations 2014 / Rheoliadau Dyrannu Tai a Digartrefedd (Cymhwystra) (Cymru) 2014

div.p: These Regulations make provision for which persons from abroad will be eligible or ineligible for an allocation of housing accommodation under Part 6 of the Housing Act 1996 (“the Act”) and for housing assistance under Part 7 of the Act. These Regulations apply in relation to Wales only.

Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud darpariaeth ynghylch pa bersonau o dramor a fydd yn gymwys neu’n anghymwys i gael dyraniad o lety tai o dan Ran 6 o Ddeddf Tai 1996 (“y Ddeddf”) a chymorth tai o dan Ran 7 o’r Ddeddf”. Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gymwys o ran Cymru yn unig.

entry.title: The Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014 (Commencement No. 7, Saving and Transitional Provisions) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order brings into force various provisions of the Anti-social Behaviour, Crime and Policing Act 2014 (“the 2014 Act”).

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (Scotland) Amendment (No. 2) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (Scotland) Regulations 1984 (“the principal Regulations”). They insert a new class of advertisement for which consent is deemed to be granted under regulation 10 of the principal Regulations. The advertisements will be placed on ground based electronic communications apparatus housing to publicise the fact that the project to which the apparatus relates has had the benefit of funding from European Union Structural Funds.

entry.title: The Children and Young People (Scotland) Act 2014 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 81(4) of the Children and Young People (Scotland) Act 2014 (“the 2014 Act”) for the purpose of bringing into force section 17A(6) of the Schools (Consultation) (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the 2010 Act”) (section 81(4) inserts section 17A(6) into the 2010 Act) and section 81(9) of the 2014 Act (which amends section 21(2) of the 2010 Act) on 6th October 2014, but only in so far as necessary to enable the Scottish Ministers to make regulations under paragraphs 1(9) and 2(5) of schedule 2A to the 2010 Act (as inserted by section 81(5) of the 2014 Act).

entry.title: The Taxis (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2014
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 24th September 2014 provisions of the Taxis Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”) specified in Part 1 of the Schedule for the purpose only of making regulations, and brings into operation on 31st October 2014 the provisions of the Act specified in Part 2 of that Schedule.

entry.title: The Lanarkshire Colleges Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order makes provision in relation to New College Lanarkshire and South Lanarkshire College.

entry.title: The Electricity Act 1989 (Exemption from the Requirement for an Interconnector Licence) (Amendment) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order amends the Electricity Act 1989 (Exemption from the Requirement for an Interconnector Licence) Order 2006 (S.I. 2006/2002) (“the 2006 Order”) in the following ways.

entry.title: The Absolute Ground for Possession for Anti-social Behaviour (Review Procedure) (England) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: Section 84A of the Housing Act 1985 (“the Act”) provides for a new, absolute, anti-social behaviour ground for possession of a dwelling that is the subject of a secure tenancy. Section 85ZA of the Act provides secure tenants of local housing authorities and housing action trusts with a right to request a review of the landlord’s decision to seek possession under section 84A. The landlord must review the decision if the tenant requests it.

entry.title: The Equality Act 2010 (Equal Pay Audits) Regulations 2014

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Equality Act 2010 (Equal Pay Audits) Regulations 2014

entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 139A and 207(1) and (4) of the Equality Act 2010 (c.15) (“the Act”). They require an employment tribunal (“tribunal”) to order a respondent to carry out an equal pay audit (“audit”) after a finding that there has been an equal pay breach. An equal pay breach is defined in section 139A of the Act as a breach of an equality clause or a contravention of sections 39(2), 49(6) or 50(6) of the Act so far as they relate to sex discrimination in relation to pay.

entry.title: The Passenger and Goods Vehicles (Recording Equipment) (Tachograph Card Fees) (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend card application fees in the Passenger and Goods Vehicles (Recording Equipment) (Tachograph Card Fees) Regulations 2005. Fee changes with the percentage decrease are shown in the table below.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) (Amendment) (No.2) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend certain fees in the Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations 1999. These Regulations also introduce lower fees for online applications for first licences and licence renewals to reflect the lower costs involved in processing online applications. Fee changes with the percentage decrease are shown in the table below.
